action.action-desc: Mr. Tiffany (for himself and Ms. Kuster) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to award grants to promote the domestic hardwood industry, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Hardwood Products Access and Development Program Act.

section.header: Hardwood Products Access and Development Program

subsection.text: The Secretary of Agriculture (in this section referred to as the Secretary) may award grants, on a competitive basis, to eligible entities to promote the domestic hardwood industry through the following activities:

paragraph.text: Research related to the low carbon footprint, carbon storage capacity, and resource sustainability of domestically produced hardwood products.
Promotion of research and education related to domestically produced hardwood products.
Promotion of the low carbon footprint, carbon storage capacity, and resource sustainability of the domestic hardwood industry.
Market promotion of domestically produced hardwood products.
Consumer market research related to domestically produced hardwood products.

Demonstration projects demonstrating the natural qualities, low carbon footprint, carbon storage capacity, and resource sustainability of domestically harvested hardwood and domestically produced hardwood products.

subsection.text: An entity is eligible to receive a grant under subsection (a) if such entity is 1 of the following:

paragraph.text: A nonprofit organization representing the domestic hardwood products industry.
An institution of higher education (as defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001)).

subsection.text: To receive a grant under subsection (a), an eligible entity shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require, includingâ€”

paragraph.text: a description of the activities to be supported using the grant funds;
a description of the goals that the eligible entity intends to achieve as a result of supporting such activities; and
an estimate of the increase in hardwood production or consumer awareness that the eligible entity anticipates will occur as a result of supporting such activities.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall promulgate such regulations as are necessary to carry out this section.

subsection.header: No preemption of State or Tribal laws
subsection.text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to preempt any law (including a law regarding liability) of a State or Indian Tribe (as defined in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304)).
The term domestically produced hardwood product means a domestically produced product that is 90 percent by volume domestically sourced hardwood material.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2029.
